place_description:
PARKING: Two parking lots/options: behind Haraz Coffee House and across the street on Hawthorne (behind 1124 Central Ave).
The country of Yemen is unapparelled to any other place on this Earth. From its breathtaking scenery to its history that dates back to the beginning of man. Yemen is the homeland of our family. As first-generation immigrants, we wanted to honor our heritage. Yemen is where coffee was invented and later flourished in global trade. Roasting and serving coffee is something that is inclusive of all people and cultures, and brings people together. Our coffee is grown from altitudes over 3,000 ft in a mountainous village called Haraz, where our namesake originates.

reviews_data.review_text: Good food
Authentic selection and good environment, wheelchair accessible and free WiFi

Oh. My. Gosh.
Obsessed. Obsessed is what I am with this place. I first tried it in Dearborn, where it's originally from, and I was in love with the shop there, and now this one is at the same level. The atmosphere is great, although the shop is small it's decorated beautifully and emphasizes the culture and beauty of Yemen. The traditional qawah and chai serving cups are such a special touch. This is unlike any coffee shop you'll go to. They have some of the best espresso I've had, and then paired with the different spices just makes it perfection. The pistachio latte... yall. They get it right EVERY time  I can say that I'm addicted, it's just tooo yummy. Now if you're not a coffee person, the adeni chai??? So creamy and spiced to perfection. I need to know what those spices are because how do they balance so well The Khaliat Nahl is so good and the soft bread paired with the creamy filling is divine. It's perfect paired with a nice cup of coffee. This is definitely a must try when you have the opportunity.

Always got myself a to go - milk cake is to die for
Tried other cakes as well
Love it
Looking forward to try their coffee as well.
Love how unique this is. Great seating, ambience, and selection.
Amazing place to visit and have delicious coffee and lot of choices of croissants and desserts
Worth the wait for some unique coffee options along with beautiful pastries
If I could get coffee here everyday I would! Best coffee in Charlotte hands down.
Excellent selection of interesting coffee beverages. I didn't try any of the food yet. The atmosphere was a bit noisy for my comfort level.

As soon as you walk in you can smell the aroma of goodness! The staff were so nice with explaining the different coffee and pastry options. Let me tell you everything was delicious

https://youtu.be/Dm2O0MVOwsk?si=8Ma1qyGLPxFV3cLF

The salted Carmel latte was delicious as well as the hazelnut pastry. My friend had the Turkish coffee and raved about it as well as the slice of cake that they had. Atmosphere was nice, and there is plenty of seating.

My foodie friend invited me everywhere and she has been ranting and raving about Haraz for some months now. Dope lil coffee shop. And their menu and hours of operation are blowing other coffee spots out of the water at this point. I ordered the pistachio frappe (yes), spinach and feta croissant (hell yea), and the Biscoff cheesecake (Fawk Yea!!). Was not disappointed in the slightest.
we loved this place!! we came visiting from florida and i wish we have a place like this

Finally, Charlotte has a chance to taste Yemeni coffee! If you happily drink Starbucks, don't bother coming here--unless you're ready to experience what real coffee can taste like.  

Great pastries too!

Haraz Coffee: A Bohemian Oasis
Haraz Coffee is a delightful escape from the ordinary. This charming cafe is a haven for coffee connoisseurs and those seeking a laid-back atmosphere. The bohemian decor, with its eclectic mix of colors and textures, creates an instantly inviting ambiance.
The coffee menu is a treasure trove for enthusiasts, boasting a diverse collection of beans from around the world. Each cup is brewed to perfection, offering a unique flavor profile that caters to every palate. Whether you're a purist or someone who enjoys their coffee with a touch of sweetness, Haraz has something to satisfy your cravings.
Beyond the exceptional coffee, the cafe also offers a tempting selection of snacks to complement your drink. The perfect accompaniment to a leisurely afternoon, these treats are as delightful as the coffee itself.
Whether you're looking to catch up with a friend, enjoy some quiet time with a good book, or simply unwind after a long day, Haraz Coffee is the ideal spot. Its cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a true gem in the heart of the city.
Highly recommended for coffee lovers and anyone in search of a tranquil retreat.

I got the pistachio latte and my friend got the saffron latte. The pistachio latte was really good but the drinks were SO expensive (almost $10 each). The saffron latte wasn't my favorite. A nice study spot though! Lot of people were studying/working here
Yes yes yes! Love the concept, the vibe, the desserts, the tea. Very enjoyable experience. With I lived closer.
Ordered the pistachio latte and chocolate pistachio chocolate cake. Delicious! Such a cute spot and if you order to have your coffee there, its presented in such a cute set up.

Coffee is good but can't say the same about the service. Customer service needs to be better. I asked one of the girls to please clean our table before our food and coffee comes and she didn't. We had to ask 3 times and she came and gave us an attitude about it.

Cappuccino was really nice. Overall nicely decorated location with well-presented products. Efficient staff. Croissant tasted like chemicals and freezer, though, and was tough-textured. Strawberry Brioche was decent but nothing to write home about.

I'd like to try more of their drinks, but I'm not so interested in the pastry anymore.
For anyone who wants to step into another country for an hour while drinking coffee, you've come to the right place

Two stars cause the Ambiance and pastries are great.

We ordered Turkish coffee and Harazi Mufawar. The cardamom flavor was extremely strong. Although I'm accustomed to adding cardamom to my tea, the quantity used in the coffee was still overwhelming.
It felt like we were drinking cardamom syrup with flavor of coffee.
Think twice before ordering a pot of anything.
Cardamom
Beautiful location, culturally refreshing change of pace. Delicious pistachio latte and pastries are to die for. Recommend: biscoff cheesecake. 10/10 good service too!
Great place, seating is just difficult due to the size of the place and popularity.
Authentic Yemeni Coffee! Way to go!

So my mom told me to get one more thing so I went and I got one drink it was cost 7 dollars I gave the guy 20 dollars but he only gave me 1 dollar and like 20 cents back I think he purposely did that because he knew I was a kid and thought I didn't notice.I only noticed when I got home when I was randomly checking the receipt

I love this place great addition to the area! It's beautifully decorated and always clean. I love their milk cakes they are delicious. I have had a few drinks but so far the Pistachio Frappe has been my favorite.

I tried the flat croissant today and it was hard to bite. I was a little disappointed that I was not able to enjoy it.

The staff and service here is great and if you love coffee, tea and pastries like me here is the place to be.

Haraz Coffee Shop is a beautiful place with delicious offerings. However, my recent experience was disappointing. I ordered a matcha, which I found to be much stronger than usual. As a frequent matcha drinker, I was surprised by its intensity and didn't enjoy it as much as I usually do.

In an attempt to adjust the flavor to my liking, I politely asked for a bit more oat milk, for which I had already paid extra. To my surprise, the manager, who had a piercing on her under lip, first requested an additional charge for the extra milk instead of inquiring why I needed it. Her approach felt unpolite and lacked understanding.

I chose not to ask for a replacement matcha, which might have been a more appropriate request given my dissatisfaction with the drink's initial taste. I simply wanted to make my drink more enjoyable by adding more milk.

While I appreciate the quality and consistency of Haraz Coffee Shop's offerings, this experience was somewhat disappointing. I hope in the future, the staff considers customer satisfaction as a priority, especially when the request is as simple as adding a bit more milk to balance out a strong drink.

I'm sad to write this review because I really liked this place in the beginning but It's getting out of hand how the employees and owners will talk to certain customers for long periods of time when there's a line. Respectfully, you can talk to them later. It's disrespectful to your other customers who are patiently waiting.

Friendly staff, exceptional coffee, stellar presentation as far as plating and latte art go--everything was thoughtful. It does get busy even late at night, so come here for community and conversation, probably not for heads down working and reading books. Overall a great experience and a chance to experience cultural influence from middle eastern origins of coffee, tea, and pastry. Loved everything I tried! Raspberry Mosaic Turkish Cake and a Latte both hit!

I have tried Haraz Coffee a few times now and the lattes I've indulged in have always been good, but pricey. $10 for an iced latte, I come here when I want to treat myself lol I've tried the Haraz version, Salted Caramel & Pistachio. The Salted Caramel is my favorite.

I'm a regular who comes in every week and I have to talk about how great of a service Salina has done, she always remembers my order and she's very friendly! Make sure to ask for the pistachio latte, a great place to get it

Wow, loved experiencing their unique countries take on coffee and pastries! The pastries and treats were over the top. The coffee was different, we all loved everything & wish they had a location near where we live! Hope to be back again.

I went for a coffee the other day and i just have to say the employee jacky was exceptional! she was very polite she has had one of the best customer service i've ever experienced i will definitely be coming back thank you jacky! :)
Customer service and cleanliness made it feel like it really was in the middle east. Sloppy barista. Illiterate cashiers. It's not a bros hang out..you guys are at work...act like it.
Love this place, awesome service, food and Atmosphere
delicious pastries and milk cakes and coffee. The arabic tea is like tea in india. Goes very well with their butter croissant

FYI to the uncultured population who say flavors like cardamom are "terrible": Arabic coffee uses spices you may not be accustomed to. Enhance your palate.

This place should not be allowed to serve Saudi or Turkish coffee. The Saudi coffee was overpowered by saffron and no other spices and was ultra watery. It is a shame because anyone who knows true Saudi coffee knows how delicious it is in its true form. The Turkish coffee was another watery joke.

Stick with the Chai Adeni or Mofawar, and beware that it WILL burn your tongue and throat because of the scorching temperature they serve it at!

Paid $16 for a Saudi and Turkish coffee!

The "garlic croissant" = bread with crusty cheese.

This place is a rip-off and only appeals to my cravings for Mofawar and Chai Adeni.
Excellant coffe and baked goods.

I put this in my new category of "Instagram Eateries" where customers are increasingly interested in a shiny atmosphere that lends itself to pretty pictures, but the food and drink are overpriced and (if I'm honest) just okay.  Aside from the fact that my $8 pistachio latte was a shade of green only made possible by artificial colors, it tasted more like a chai latte than anything remotely resembling a pistachio.  And I waited about half an hour to get it.  I've also seen two baristas move through a line of 30-40 people with much more efficiency.  At times, it felt there were as many people "working" behind the bar as there were standing on our side of the register.  What were they doing?  I opted out of a pastry because they looked like a far cry from anything that could be made fresh in house.  I just don't get the hype.

This is the coolest coffee shop I've ever been too and probably the best one as well! The atmosphere of this place is just absolutely wonderful! The plating of your food is beautiful. If I lived closer there would be a weekly stop here, if not daily....
Best coffee in charlotte!
Wow, you guys are amazing! A breath of fresh air, in the middle of nowhere :-)  excuse the rhyme

Me and my friends and I came here to hang out and do a little bit of homework. The place was a bit busy, probably because of the time we chose. It was a Wednesday at around 4 pm. It's a very cozy place to stay at, the prices are affordable, and the staff is very kind. If you go through the enter facing the street, that's where you'll find the register. But if you go around and enter through the back, there is more seating back there, but it is made for more quiet studying. Definitely recommend!!
Love the Adeni Chai and Kinafa cheesecake!! So far enjoyed the chocolate and Zatar croissants. Can't wait to try the bee bites and milk cakes.

The atmosphere was very nice . But small and busy. We ended up ordering to go. We ordered a frozen caramel drink and a maleki coffee which was quite spicy and not sweet at all I'm thinking I suppose to do it myself. The bakery item was fine I like cheese cake with what I think is shredded phyllo dough and some spices on top.Also we got one milk cake. Not sweet as you will think.Overall good but not used to the spices like those on bakery or coffee.

The food and drinks are excellent (albeit pricey) and the coffee shop is an excellent addition to the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. While they are usually very busy the average wait time for your order ranges from 15-30 minutes. I went this morning and noticed a gentleman delivering goods behind the counter with Walmart brand items in Walmart grocery bags. This begs the question of is this is a usual occurrence or if this is a one off.
The coffee and pastries were great.  The service not so great.  Many unbused tables, bathroom and hand washing stations out of order.
The best Coffee
They have the best coffee Ana tea ever

i ordered a caramel macchiato but wasn't expecting a spice taste to it, which to me threw off the flavor of a regular caramel macchiato & tasted kind of bitter as a aftertaste. i was devastated. i understand the theme of this coffee shop but i just didn't think much of a different version of a caramel macchiato. just a heads up to anyone! the inside is very beautiful though :)
Wonderful place, excellent coffee and perfect pastries, the best is the only coffee open until 11:00 pm! If you visited or living in Charlotte you have to go!!
Place was busy. The overall ambiance was good. I ordered the biscotti cheesecake.  It was just ok. I really didn't taste and cheesecake. Got my frappe without sugar and it really good.
Small coffee shop but the coffee is worth it alone. The food was good as well. I will definitely be going back

Really didn't like that I waited over 20 mins to get a pastry that was already prepared. Literally she could have turned around and just handed it to me at the register. Then the waiting area is jam packed and you have to stand over people who are trying to eat. They need a manager to review the process and identify a better way. Making people wait over 20 minutes for items that are already ready to go and simply need to be bagged and handed to the customer is ridiculous. You have people who have to wait for things like coffee or items that need to be prepared but why make someone wait for a ready made item that is literally sitting right next to the cashier. She could have handed it to me in the time it took for my card to process at the register. That was so ridiculous and time consuming. It's like 19 workers behind the register the place is already small so the fact that the waiting line for people who are just grabbing a ready pastry is as long as the foods that need prep is crazy. Also the taste of the item I purchased simply wasn't fresh and the taste wasn't good.

I really wanted to love Haraz Coffee House in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte, but I just didn't. This is simply an Instagram coffee shop. Yes... the things they make and do are pretty. The pastries are pretty. The copper cups for the Turkish coffee are pretty... as are other items they sell. All of this makes for nice pictures. The middle eastern theme is novel for the area, too. I just didn't enjoy anything I ate or drank.... This was the most atypical Turkish coffee I've ever had... watery, weak, light, uninteresting.... All my other Turkish coffee experiences were dark, strong and robust, including the traditional fine grounds at the bottom of the cup. I didn't like the food either... something was just a bit strange with all that I tried.... Including the pastry flake being soggy, not crisp.

To me, this is where you go to take pictures and pretend you're having a great time...and perhaps pretend you're being multi-cultural. If you truly enjoy good coffee, there are better options around with fewer frills.
Muhammad was amazing and great service. Coffee was good and food was good. Will definitely come back.
I love the mocha here, it's so good

SLoW service. I was greeted and told I'll be right with you as this barista was busy riding solo so it seemed. I ordered a latte extra hot and unfortunately it wasn't extra hot as requested upon receipt. it was made again yet again a fail. The lack of detail in the art work needs much improvement. Clean environment with accessible parking in front, side and rear of the building.
I tried the Adenai Chai. It was amazing. The entire place is aesthetically pleasing with excellent beverages and food. I loved the spinach feta pastry!

I went there to have some coffee and desert the coffee was good but the service and the line was bad . I got this cake that was dry and flavorless i had one bite and requested another desert they refused to do so ... paid 9$ for that small piece   ended up waste.

LOVED IT!! Had the Haraz Mufawar coffee and croissants (spinach&feta, milk chocolate and almond)

Croissants were really flavorful and coffee was great!!

Will stop by next time for the pot experience :)
I was impressed by the food and the services received. I had to give them a 4 star just due to lack of seats and parking space.

Excellent! From the tea to the atmosphere to the pastries, this place is a gem! I cannot enough good things how authentic this place is! Keep it up

Can't wait to have this in other major cities. Very fresh products with professional and attentive staff.
The best coffee,  desserts and customer service!!!!!!
This is the best coffee in south and North Carolinas

Coffee was interesting in a wonderful way. I would go back if I was in the area.
The bee bites were just ok, but I'd like to try other options next time.

Found out about this place through IG reels, and since i am big coffee and bakery fan, that place immediately was on my list. We definitely enjoyed Turkish coffee with Turkish cake, and oreo&cream croissant. Wish they had more outdoor sitting since it's very busy inside.
My kind of deliciousness great place and great taste
Coffee and pastries are good. The only thing that I didn't like is that you are forced to have 16oz coffee. So you have to pay $8 for a cup of coffee.
Love this cafe! Great food, friendly staff, and a warm atmosphere. My go-to spot - always feel welcome!
Love it! My new fave coffee shop in Charlotte. Love the taste of the coffee, and bakery items are delicious.

Love this place!! I asked for multiple pastries and coffee and it came out so fast! Even though the space is small, the atmosphere is amazing!
Will be back!
Caramel Macchiato here is amazing. Definitely a must try. Small space, but quality drinks and superb service. They turned me into a regular very quickly.

THIS is how life should be. This is the best coffee I've ever had in my life.

This place serves REAL coffee- not the sugar syrup and chemical-laden stuff you find in mainstream cafes that causes disease.

I had the Maleki - made with strong coffee, ginger, and real cream. This is real coffee that energizes and inspires you. Coffee that makes you want to look across the table and have an invigorating conversation with the person across from you.

Wonderful music. Wonderful atmosphere. Incredible food. Incredible coffee.

Everything was great the drinks and pastries are fresh and taste wonderful. The only thing I would recommend is turning down the music volume in the cafe and equally if the workers can work more quietly they won't need to turn up the music. It was kind of chaotic because the guests were having to speak louder because the workers are loud and so they turn up the music so everyone can hear it. Anyways if everything could be a bit more quiet it would be perfect!

Definitely should put a tag on the bakery items in the window identifying which is which. We were way confused and had to ask for help.

But, overall the coffee and all the pastries were great!

Will definitely recommend the mango cheesecake.
Good choice of coffee but its overrated for the quality!! Limited space hard to find a spot.

After hearing a lot about this place, finally got a chance to visit this exquisite Middle Eastern Cafe today morning. They have tons of middle eastern coffee & tea varieties starting from Arabic to Turkish coffee as well as regular expresso options. Similarly the pastries are gorgeous with many middle eastern favorites like the Bee bites , Turkish cakes, Round croissants and others. All of them tasted great. The only reason why I didn't give it a 5 star was the service which was not aligned with Middle eastern hospitality. The person who took the order and the servers didn't seem friendly & welcoming. That's something which can definitely add to the whole experience.

Good coffee, although I ordered Turkish coffee which they served in a cezve and I asked for a cup (demitasse) and the waiter said curtly "It's Turkish coffee", like you are supposed to drink it out of a cezve. Rude. I got a to-go cup and used that and it was fine.
Very nice coffee shop her in Charlotte.

First - the establishment while aesthetically pleasing was dirty. The tables had crumbs on them I almost did not want to sit down to wait on my order.
Second- I was asked if I wanted my bagel bites warmed even though the order was Togo I said yes. They were still cold and hard. People that eat on the go exist , why ask if you weren't going to do it.
Third- I asked for a cup of water to go she handed me an open plastic cup with my bag of baked goods and coffee that spilled instantly when she put it in my hand. Why not give me a cup with a lid for TOGo order??

I was really exited for a good coffee shop on central ave. I have to honor that my white latte was good but because of these occurrence in my experience I won't be back. Better options with better service on central ave - milk bread , vilanis, hell even Starbucks.
Coffee is great

Absolutely loved the coffee and the bakery, had to buy everything twice because couldn't stop how much I loved it, everything was delicious, the place is pretty small , perfect for walk in when you take a walk nearby, we were there on Monday so it wasn't packed, we enjoyed our girls time out and delicious coffee and bakery options. Parking nearby and free not too big parking on premises. Monday afternoon worked perfect for us for parking and sitting.

What a special treat for a coffee house in Plaza Midwood!  I enjoyed a Turkish coffee while doing some work on my laptop, and made new friends with people around me. A lovely environment, welcoming all cultures, and delicious coffee. I also like that they open early on Sunday mornings.   Give them a try, if you haven't already.

Calling all coffee loverrrsss... This has to be one of the best coffee houses in Charlotte! The staff is super helpful in helping you decide which coffee to get. The desserts are delicious, great place to come study or do some work! Just know their coffee will have you super pumped on caffeine  I wanted more and the staff was like ummm are you sure, would you like to try a different drink  like they knew my cut off limit lol any way great place to come enjoy some fresh delicious coffee and get your caffeine fix
The bakeries are so delicious. The coffee is amazing. Try Adani tea as well. The place is perfect for gathering and refresh yourself with many different kinds of coffees

Coffee and drinks were great! Service was prompt and courteous. The Harazi iced coffee was strong and flavorful. They add cardamom and cream to a cold brew coffee, not a sweet drink, but that's perfect for me. Add some honey for some added sweetness, if that's your style. Chairs are comfortable. Tried the raspberry croissant, strawberry croissant and spinach and feta croissant. Will be back!

They have a really great environment here! It's  chill and comfortable and the music is always nice! I ordered the Pistachio Latte and a Berry Milk Cake so delicious!! Definitely worth stopping by. Will be coming back to try different items on their menu :) *thumbs up*

When I heard a Middle Eastern coffee shop was in Charlotte I had to try it. Their pastries were amazing. They sell those viral stuffed croissants like the ones at Lafayette Cafe in NYC where you see a line around the block for. Well no line here for them. I got the pistachio flavor and I and going to try others in the future. The Haraz latte tasted good but it tasted like a regular latte. I am trying the saffron or pistachio latte next time. The prices are NY prices I paid $15.00 for the drink and pastry. But it might be cheaper for the viral croissant.

Normally I don't write complains, but this is  unacceptable. I had heard of this place via Instagram and was looking forward to try one of their chocolate mosaic cakes. I ordered one butter croissant, and a chocolate mosaic cake to go. However I did not get anything I ordered. I have a severe nut allergy, and if I hadn't looked closely at the mosaic cake before eating, I would be in the hospital right now. I had gotten the pistachio mosaic cake, and even my presumably butter croissant was wrong, and an almond croissant stared back at me. So not only did they charge me a lot, they gave me two things I could not eat. If I could give them 0 stars I would. Cute cafe tho

Really nice atmosphere, really good service and smells like coffees and confectionery and kinda smokey from the roasting.  Parking is tight but there is nookey seating even outside.  The decoration of the room is beautiful and more elaborate than I would expect and the mural was awesome the tile was representative.  I chose the red tea and it was so bold.  We also had the b-bites.
Super the Best!!!
Very unique place to visit with great selection of various caffeinated drinks including very authentic chai. Highly recommend.

This is my husband and I spot! We try to go every week when he's off! We've tried almost everything so far! Their pastries are AMAZING! I haven't had anything I didn't like yet! Nice atmosphere and very popular!

Such a beautiful clean and respectful place to have a coffee and grab a bite. The staff is friendly, healthful, the place is organized and the vibes are real!!! Would recommend their Turkish coffee and pistachio cake, most creamy and fluffy thing in the world!!!!

I had a delightful visit to Haraz Coffee House, a place that deserves every bit of its five stars. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for enjoying their unique coffee offerings and exquisite desserts.

We ordered a Turkish coffee and an Iced Harazi Coffee, along with a selection of desserts including a pistachio mosaic Turkish cake, saffron milk cake, and berry milk cake. The Turkish coffee was authentic and rich, just as you'd expect, served with a traditional touch.

The Iced Harazi Coffee was a new experience for me. The barista mentioned it was stronger than regular iced coffee with espresso, but I found it surprisingly lighter and very refreshing. Although it wasn't as strong as I anticipated, the flavor was exceptional and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

The desserts were a highlight too. Each cake was beautifully presented and tasted as good as they looked. The pistachio mosaic Turkish cake was delightfully nutty, the saffron milk cake was subtly flavored and perfectly sweet, and the berry milk cake was wonderfully light and fruity.

Additionally, the branding and style of the location added to the overall experience. The chic to-go cups, gold utensils, and trendy black plates showcased their attention to detail and enhanced the stylish ambiance.

Haraz Coffee House is a gem for anyone who loves coffee and sweets. The service is excellent, with attentive and knowledgeable staff. I highly recommend a visit for a truly enjoyable coffee experience!
Amazing coffee shop! The coffee tastes so fresh and the spices they add are so lovely. I need to try the cakes next time. Will definitely return!
Always busy and not enough chairs but food is delicious
Nice ambiance, good coffee
Excellent cafe, with great coffee, and delicious dessert, but the staff needs to be more attentive to clean off the table for the next guest to have seats.
Wonderful place wonderful atmosphere the treats were so yummy everything love it here will be back
On Central Ave, it's busy, but there is plenty of seating inside. I think there's a no stairs option on the back side of the building.

The selection of drinks and desserts here is unlike anything I've seen in Charlotte. I ordered the iced salted caramel latte and chocolate croissant. Both were amazing! My friend ordered the iced caramel macchiato and bee bites, which she really liked as well. Our orders came out very quickly and the staff was very kind and helpful. We loved the atmosphere here and will definitely be back again.
Love love love the iced Adani chai and all of their desserts are phenomenal
Wonderful first visit to Haraz Coffee House! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and incredible coffee!! Looking forward to my next visit!

My husband and I drove down this morning, after months of seeing Instagram posts, and we were not disappointed!
Very clean establishment, with a great atmosphere and really great service. We did get in right as they opened, so we didn't have to wait long for our order.
I had the Rada'ai Chai (delicious)
And to go I grabbed a Mufawar (which I'm very much enjoying as I write this)
My husband enjoyed the Iced Harazi and his very first Turkish Coffee.
I'm waiting to try the bee bread and mosaic cake that we are taking home, but after the saffron milk cake, which was so very good, I have no doubt that my taste buds will be delighted.
We will absolutely be back! Great experience.
My friends and I visited Haraz, where we enjoyed the excellent tea and ambiance.

Only giving an extra star because it IS very nice inside and my sister enjoyed her cake.

Went in last weekend and was told I couldn't order anything iced because they ran out of ice. Full stop. However, in the time it took me to go nextdoor and grab a drink from share tea, the gal next to me sat down with a fully iced latte. She was nice, but definitely not helping if that makes sense.
Nice place if you are looking for Turkish coffee. Everyone very friendly in there.
Beautiful coffee shop with great customer service!
Very cool spot. Make me feel like I was vacationing in another world.  The feta and cheese pastry was awesome and the foods are served up with an international flair.

After all the pictures and videos I had seen of this place, I had to go try it but was completely disappointed. The pastries looked amazing and was hard to choose one or two. We went for the most popular (strawberry croissant $6.50) and the Biscoff cheesecake $8. They both looked delicious but tasted 2/10. First of all, I dont think the croissant is actual croissant dough as it was not flaky and had the consistency of a normal bread, more like a Brioche. The Biscoff tasted better but still lacked so much flavor!
Another thing is that the place has probably 5 comfortable places to sit, the rest are regular wooden chairs, but almost everything was taken over by students who had probably been there for hours. So one goes to enjoy the atmosphere, and the place is beautifully decorated, but you are left with no choice and have to sit in the uncomfortable chairs or take it to go.
Now, customer service, was terrible. The girl that took our order was nice but knew little about their products. They probably had 6 people behind the counter just chatting and flirting with each other and left us, the customers, the job of cleaning tables in order to be able to sit there to enjoy our purchase
This place needs to improve so much in management and train their employees, and im very sure they dont need so many employees who are not doing anything, really. But Im sad to say I would not be back here, or recommend it to friends. Lots of room to improve!
Love love. My favorite is adeni kadak chai and pistachio latte. Must try is there milk cakes. Overall its one of my favorite coffee shops in clt.

I adore Haraz and it's instant popularity makes me really happy. This is a great example of what's possible when you break out of the hipster-coffee-shop box.

My favorite is the Adeni tea. It's the kind of thing you wake up at 2:30am thinking about - its strong, rich, and dreamy (I swear I'm talking about the tea ). The staff is warm and helpful and the menu is amazing (try the milk cake, or bee bites). Yall, it get CRAZY busy though - be prepared to stand in line.

Happy to ditch the hipster haunts to hang here!

I visited Haraz Coffee House and was displeased with the service. This was my first time visiting. I ordered a Turkish coffee that was really good and wanted to know the different types of pastries that were offered. The response was "croissants and bread". It would've been nice to know the options. I'm not a coffee/pastry connoisseur.

Extremely bad experience. I visited last week Sunday with my family to this coffee shop. I waited in lane to place my order for 30 minutes ( no complaints about that) since it was busy. I order hot Cortado and pistachios latte. When  I got my order to our table my pistachios latte was cold and I requested them to warm up the and they refus to warm it up and said you will need to buy new coffee, we don't warm up. I was like what you just said ? Buy, a new coffee and replies yes. I felt so bad, I already end up giving them a tip ( not complain, I always give tips). Is this the good customer service? This is how you  treat your customers. I'll never ever visit them nor would recommend anyone.

1st timer. Smells are delightful. Coffee is good & the pastry selected was a little dry. The environment is great to meet & greet or just work on electronics. I love the traditional food & music.
Great experience
I am reluctant to leave this review because it's so packed already but this place is a gem. Order the iced pistachio latte . Also the milk cakes are great too. Enjoy
Turkish coffee is not authentic

I got the Turkish coffee and almond croissant. Very delicious! I've been looking for a local place that had Turkish coffee too. Perfect atmosphere for working. Saw people on first dates, meeting up for book club, etc and works well for all. Love the music playing. The decor and vibes are great too. I can't wait to come back and try more. 

WiFi was not working when I was here, so make sure you have a hotspot of some sorts as a backup if you plan to work on a laptop while you are here.
Also not a lot of outlets besides some tables near the front door that I could see so make sure to be fully charged, or have an extra charger just in case.

Haraz is one of my favorite to go place for a coffee and quick bite. I usually go for Karak Tea and my wife goes for their iced pistachio latte, also their bee bite is very deliciousSaed is very friendly and always welcoming. 10/10 definitely recommended and worth the wait.

The staff just had no interest to greet or even look at the face.

Ordered a knafe, berry cake to go and a hot coffee with extra milk on the side.

They did not provide plastic cutlery for the to go, milk was ice cold and most of all, they gave me two cakes instead of one cake and one kunafe.

I had to go Twice once to get the cutlery and once to fix the wrong order. They were not talking or even willing to say a word. Just felt very uncomfortable. The space is also too small and crowded and not comfortable. Desserts and coffee however was okay, not the best though.

The staff need to be more trained and just willing to work!!

The line is out the door for a good reason! This is what Charlotte was missing. Must-try coffees, teas, and desserts. The vibes of the place are immaculate. The people are friendly. My new favorite coffee shop!

Pasties were amazing
Drinks was good
It sucks because I wanted to enjoy the Turkish coffee style that they had but it was crowded. Maybe next time
The place is nice. Coffee was good . Unfortunately croissants don't taste good but looks nice .

From cashier to the person making our drinks were amazing. We got the berry milk CAKE, honeybites, Turkish cake, Haraz latte, hazelnut latte, strawberry lemonade, and hot chocolate. Everything was delicious  and we'll definitely be back to try out more items.
Excellent experience! I had the Adeni chai, pistachio circle croissant, and the honeycomb bread-- all were great! Definitely recommend
Best coffee ever!!!!!!!!

Amazing! My wife and I had Saudi Coffee and a Pistachio Latte and both were great. The Baklava Cheesecake was incredible and the Pistachio Croissant was my personal favorite. They were fairly quick and friendly. Love it will definitely come back!

Great coffee (their cold brew was better than their latte and I was shocked lol) and a really nice selection of pastries. I wasn't able to try the pastries but we went around 10:30 and a lot of pastries were already gone.

The seating is tight and there isn't really outside seating so be prepared to not be able to sit and chill there. The place is nice inside and comfy if you can find a seat.

I'd definitely come back again for the coffee and treats but I'd ding it for parking and not having enough space.

The coffee is good. Expensive. But good. Spent $67 on coffee and pasties and had the worst customer service experience. The girl with the attitude with the big tattoos on her neck took our order & couldn't even tell me what sort of cheesecake was in the case. She was very rude - never gave me a receipt never gave me a buzzer. Just rude. You'd think spending $70 on 4 drinks and a few pastries the customer service would be better. I could care less to come back based on the service. The pastries are good though.
First time trying this place I was asking the guy to give me some of the desert and he start getting frustrated just because I ask him for what I want pls find better employ or u guys won't last long
Coffee is amazing, pastries are delicious and environment is charming. Very good quality Coffee! I recommend

Finally got to try this coffee shop. The chocolate cronut was not very good, it was filled with a cream that was supposed to be chocolate flavor but didn't taste like it. I left 90% of it.
Cappuccino was good.
Charlotte is full of coffee shop and this one does not make the top of the list for sure.
I got my coffee to-go and it was excellent. Will be back when I have more time to dine in

First- I don't easily review places.

My wife and I stopped in the new Charlotte location last night at 6:30, and were sooo excited about trying this place.

She walked in and went to the counter to ask questions about what's best order. Before she could order, One of the The two girls literally ran away from the cash register laughing and intentionally ignoring her- and yes INTENTIONAL  is the key part of that phrase. The guy beside her didn't know how to react and just walked away out of sight as well (all immediately in front of my wife.).

I was waiting outside with our dogs- and she immediately just asked to leave because she was so frustrated and wondering why they were so rude.

We are huge coffee and dessert lovers- and had been looking forward to loving this place. I also order lots of deserts for my office, and recommend good coffee Places to our friends a lot.

Shame on yall. You won't last long.

I love that is open until midnight, not easy to find coffee late.  We got there around 9pm, waited on line for 15 min, waited another 10 min for our drinks and croissants and were very lucky to find a table, place is very full constantly. The presentation was beautiful. The plain croissant was a bit hard in the middle.  The almond croissant was better, tender, not too sweet.  The turkish coffe tastes overwhelmingly of cardamon, barely a hint of coffee, not strong, compared with waterbean or starbucks.  I ordered chocolate and it was the usual sweet drink. Not bad.

An amazing place. Owner is one fine gentleman with a big kind heart. Super friendly customer oriented service and open chill atmosphere. Highly recommended!!! Definitely a must visit spot in Charlotte, NC.

I have been to the cafe twice and it is highly overcrowded always . I believe it should have more space for seating and the staff is so busy taking orders that they don't care about the cleanliness of the place . I asked to clean my table multiple times but still no one showed up . Honestly the chai tastes just okay so think twice before going to this place. They should hire more servers.
Friendly service , amazing coffee , nice gathering spot

This is a cozy vibe and yummy coffee and cakes. I really enjoyed sitting and chatting it was comfortable.  I would say it's super busy because it just opened so be ready to wait about 10-1/ mins.  I do with the pastries in the case we're labeled.

At 5:30pm on a Friday night (rainy) we found a table to sit and we ordered a 16oz Harazi Mufawar coffee and one pistachio cream round croissant.

16oz coffees are served in a paper to go cup (even if you're dining in). I was looking forward to drinking in a glass mug/cup, so a bit disappointed with the experience. The coffee had a beautiful cardamom aroma, slight froth and minimal sweetness. It tasted delicious if you like strong, not so sweet coffee.  It was not bitter at all.

The croissant itself was dry and stale. The pistachio cream was subtle in flavor and nice and the crunchy pistachio crust was also nice. Unfortunately the round croissant missed the mark for me.

I am usually hesitant to order pastries at the end of the day, however, because of Ramadan, I assumed they were freshly baked because sunset was fast approaching.

Next time I will try pastries earlier in the day and also from their traditional menu (Bee Bites or Mosaic cake).
Lovely atmosphere, high quality drinks and pastries

Not a coffee drinker but I'll certainly drink coffee here. Love the flavors of their coffee. Unlike anything I've had before. Place is crowded at 7am till 11pm for good reason. I think they need a bigger building or maybe not. Definitely recommend.
Loved the caramel macchiato & berry milk cake, however tables were dirty.
Been here multiple times, great people, great menu, a little extra rush, but that just means they doing something right.
Turkish coffee is not Turkish coffee!
It's my favorite spot in Charlotte. Divine coffee and cakes. Won't be disappointed, I promise.

This place is amazing! Relaxing music, delicious food and coffee,and extremely nice employees!
Drove all the way from SC to try it and its an absolute hit! You cannot go wrong in anyway here!
Very good atmosphere coffee and dessert are amazing. Place to come back and chil
Very good, the pistachio croissant was my favorite.
Finally some real coffee and tea in Charlotte.
Great food. Great coffee

I've been wanting to try this after seeing how long the line has been since they opened and it did not disappoint! The Haraz latte and spinach and feta pastry were my favorite but we tried 5 pastries and all were so good

Absolutely loved being there. The decor is so gorgeous and authentic. The vibes are relaxed and inviting. The staff was very helpful and happy to be working there. The turkish and safron latte were delicious. Even more so were the 6 different desserts we brought back home with us. Berry milk case was my favorite.  Overall an excellent expedience, can't wait to go back again. Highly recommend!

The haraz coffee was amazing! Not too sweet, strong, or acidic. Perfectly balanced with spices. The aroma was just as pleasant as the aftertaste. The pastries were all just as delightful as the coffee. We tried the pistachio flavors. Delectable to say the least! The service was so kind. As it was my first time I needed help deciding. The seemly owner, although busy, was so kind. As was the person who took our order. I wish the best for this business and am happy to come back

The drinks and desserts were delicious and had great quality! Would definitely come back again!

Recommendations: Pistachio Iced Latte, Matcha Iced Latte, Kunafa Cheesecake, Croissant, and Bee Bites!!
An awesome coffee shop with a cool middle-eastern theme. Their coffee and tea is good and the staff are super nice.

Went here on a whim during a quick visit in Charlotte. Super crowded but that's saying something because the coffee was AMAZING. Salted caramel latte and the caramel macchiato were divine. Wish we lived closer, but a must visit!
Great First experience, I little busy, hard to find a tablle.
good menu! line was out the door. will be coming back to try more of the menu. I will say I like tous le jour and sunflour more
It's an authentic and so rich and delicious. I was shocked to see it packaged to the brim with people. I love the Salted Carmel Latte
Love it
Food and Coffee was good!

If you only like Starbucks beverages, don't come here. If you want a decaf option, don't come here. If you only like sweet coffees, do not come here. If you need a place to study/rest/work, do not come here (extremely crowded and loud -  could not get a table). I was told their traffic is like that all day. I ordered a white mocha, and my Dad ordered a mocha. It took at least 30 minutes of us standing there from start to finish from ordering to holding our drinks. This is not a place to go if you are in a hurry. I did not sense the employees cared about how long it took, and they had plenty of staff behind the bar. Positives: the pastries are delicious, the theme makes you feel like you're in Turkey, their products have an outstandingly beautiful execution, and it's brand new. Negatives: they automatically put cardamom or some other spice into the coffee even when it is not mentioned on the menu. It gave me a headache and my Dad didn't care for it either, so we both poured half of our drinks down the drain. This place is expensive. 2 coffees and 2 pastries was $28.00. If you're adventurous, have an exotic palate that is open to everything, and if you'd like an experience, this is place to go. You pay for the experience. Kind of like Disney. I'm glad I tried it, but will not be back.

So, there are pros and cons to this place.
Pros: It's delicious and there are some really neat things to try. We got a small pot of the Harazi Mufawar and it was plenty for 2 people. Lots of unique desserts - the milk cake was really good (similar to tres leches). The pistachio croissant and chocolate turkish cake were decent but nothing I'd need to eat again. They didn't have the bee bites which are one of of their most popular items.

The con is the lack of space. This is not a good place for groups of more than 2. We showed up at 11am on a Saturday and stood in a line out the door for quite a while and weren't sitting down with our food until about 45 minutes later. It's not due to being under-staffed, as they have plenty of people on the line working. Things take a while to make and people don't move through tables quickly if they're drinking a whole pot of coffee. So all in all, yes I would come back but probably in the evening when it's quieter. Also the ambiance is nothing super special.
*parking lot is behind the building and there is a small seating area in the back!
Thank you for finally making a chai that isn't overly sweet and tastes authentic. Didn't get any treats this time but definitely will next time.
Beautiful but no GF options :(
thank you for service for cakes for coffee the best coffee in the north caroline!!!

Recommend visiting if you're not in a rush or plan to work from here (not many electrical outlets). We waited 40 mins for our coffee, and it wasn't a grand opening. Just a regular rainy Saturday night. I'd recommend they have greater seating availability because it attracts a high # of customers. I felt bad watching someone sit on a window (which is clearly not meant for seating bc it's a narrow window sill) reading a book with her coffee on her lap while I waited for my order next to her because there weren't any seats available and it was raining outside. This place has potential!! Food is great. Cmon Haraz! We want to support you and come back!
10/10 Customer service was so amazing!! And the good drinks were a plus

We went at 8pm on a Friday and Haraz was BUSY. We got a medium pot of Qishir, a decaffeinated drink made from coffee husks, ginger and cardamom. It was perfect after dinner drink. The seats are comfy. I will definitely go back try their other drinks and pastries.

Haraz coffee house is a true hidden gem in the world of coffee shops! The environment was friendly and welcoming, as soon as I came in. The smells of freshly brewed coffee and pastries put a smile on my face  and the warm atmosphere instantly made me feel relaxed.
This place has really great coffee. Every taste demonstrates their med roast coffee beans that actually come from Yemen. You won't be let down whether you want a traditional, an espresso, a smoothie,a latte. Even a refresher they have it all and with perfection and a smile on their faces, the baristas create every drink with LOVE ! Beyond only coffee, there's a delicious array of pastries to choose from. ( I recommend the bee bites and the round croissants ) They always have freshly made pastries every morning , they make for a perfect pairing with your coffee of choice.
However, Haraz's outstanding customer service is what really makes it stand out. The staff is eager to make your stay unforgettable, they were really nice and hilarious. Their passion for what they do is outstanding . This is the place to be whether you're looking for a peaceful spot to work, meet up with friends, or simply to enjoy a delicious cup of coffee. It has become my favourite place to have my  coffee, and I can't say enough good things about it.

New favorite cafe! Their sweets are out of this world! We tried the kanafeh cheesecake, the raspberry chocolate mosaic turkish cake, and the biscoff milk cake. I was blown away by each one! If you love kanafeh and cheese cake, you MUST try it!
I also ended up buying their housemade Adeni chai bag and made it at home. Super yummy!
The staff were very welcome and kind!
I'll have to travel over 1000 miles for this place from CO, but will definitely be back

coffee is really good. Order pistachio and haraz coffee cappuccino instead of latte cause i like my coffee strong, really flavorful. Also tried yemeni bread with cream cheese inside, little balls of happiness... Just take in consideration: long line
Best pistachio latte in town!

The food was great, so was the customer service. The atmosphere of the store is nice, but tiny. There was a line outside the store, which left the front end of the store fairly cold. Other than that, overall, it was a nice visit. I'll definitely recommend.
It's a really nice place to share a breakfast...
Great service, coffee and food. Highly recommend this coffee shop and it's worth the 30 minute drive I have to make to go there.

The restaurant was packed and it did make it a bit noisy. Wait time was a little long due to the amount of people. But the wait was worth it. I got the caramel macchiato with a honey add on, and it was amazing. Very smooth and not too strong and not too sweet. I would definitely come back and try something else on the menu
Best in town

We tried Haraz tonight for the first time. Well they're now our new favorite. The Pistachio latte is outstanding! We ordered quite a few desserts to try and all are amazing but the pistachio croissant is exceptional! The tiramisu cheesecake and Biscoff cheesecake are both delicious. The pistachio milk cake is a definite winner! The service is great and staff is super friendly and really nice. Overall our experience was a full 12 out of 10! We will be putting Haraz in our rotation!
Great Atmosphere

Let's talk about this 5 star coffee and tea shop!!

Prior to visiting for the week my sister insisted that I try out the new kid on the block called Haraz Coffee house. She told me it was not far from my parents home so it was a no brainer that I was going to check it out.

Following church service on Sunday my mom and I stopped by. We were fortunate enough  to find parking. However, please note it is limited. There is a small lot behind the shop as well as a few spots on the side of the building. Walking up there was a decent line outside and  down the side walk. I would NOT recommend coming on a Sunday if you are in a rush. I am fairly  certain it took me about 45 minutes to get a drink!

This spot is small. There is limited seating so most will likely be getting orders to go. However, note that there are additional seats towards the rear of the shop. You can also enter and exit at the back.

I ordered the saffron latte with oat milk and only half  the sugar  ( a tablespoon is the standard amount). I also opted to try a plain croissant since the pistachio was already sold out.  They take your name when you place  your order and call it out when your order is ready.  Since they are crazy busy right now it can get a little hectic towards the back area where you wait for your order.  I also  purchased a bag of the chai tea it was $30 but appears to be enough for a decent amount of drinks. I can't  wait to try it!

The saffron tea was amazing! It is a different taste, more earthy, but it is my vibe. I honestly think I would  enjoy it with no sugar. The croissant was perfect--- light, buttery and oh so tasty!

Soooo- I enjoyed my experience so much that my mom and I returned today to meet my sister! This time my mom ordered the saffron tea and we substituted sugar for honey. I ordered the pistachio latte  with the honey sub too. Both of our drinks were made with oat milk. We split an almond croissant today!  We  were  able to enjoy our treats as dine in customers today!  The drinks and croissant did not disappoint. My order today came up to about $23 for two drinks and a croissant

I LOVE this spot!  If you are a tea and/or coffee drinker I highly recommend checking this spot out! They are open from 6am to 11pm Monday to  Friday and 7am   To 11pm on Saturday and Sunday. In addition to the amazing drinks they offer  a number  of pastries that look amazing! This would make for a great after dinner spot  for dessert!

I hope you check it out and fall in love with it as much as I did!

Listen! Since opening I can't stay out of this place ! It's no other coffee shop like it around here in Charlotte. Major brownie points due to them being open 7 days a week until 11pm which is unheard of here . Every time now I visit it's jam packed so I suggest arriving early or mid day when it slows down .

My top favorites here you have to try the salted caramel latte & bee bites ! Others also love the pistachio & saffron latte . I honestly believe you can't go wrong with anything you choose here . Now they offer mostly sweets & desserts so I'll be glad when & if they add actual breakfast sandwiches to the mix !

Make your way to this one of a kind specialty coffee shop & go catch all the Arabian vibes inside !

my FAVORITE coffee shop in clt!!! First of all, I just love the space. It's decorated very nicely, and it feels comfortable. The employee's are always beyond nice to me and give amazing recommendations. Im not too much of a coffee drinker, but just the taste of the coffee i've had here is SOOO much better tasting. Everything in here is quality, and it's family owned!! do yourself a favor and come here !! (and get the milk cake, its other worldly)
Awesome specialty coffee house! Great pastries, spot-on coffee and tea, and a chill vibe. Perfect for enjoying a tasty treat. Highly recommended!
Amazing coffee, teas and desserts.  What  a delight and what a find!!!
Highly recommended, their customer service is excellent. All Drinks are tasty and special without any doubt.

One of the staff members, Ahmed, from Mauritania is an unprofessional womaniser. Every time I go, he is always flirting with my wife, even though she's told him that she is married. I love the food, coffee, and atmosphere but Ahmed really ruins the experience for me. Every time I go, I worry that he'll make the interaction with my wife weird, which is unfortunate. I'm confident that she not the only woman that he's doing this to, and I really hope that management holds him accountable for his unprofessional conduct.

A relative from Michigan recommended I check out Haraz Coffee House.

This place really is All THE RAGE, right now! I can see why! It's definitely unique. This is unlike any other coffee place in Charlotte.

It's the weekend, we expected the line would be long and a as a Google Guide, I pay close attention to employees including the management. These folks were knocking orders out!

We decided on the pot of Saudi coffee & several pastries. I can't say no to croissants plain and with almonds.

My husband & son went with a chocolate sprinkled generously with pistachios. Everything was  perfect!

As a girl who grew up with a mom & relatives from Iraq, Turkish coffee was common but this visit to Haraz, was a unique experience for myself, my son and husband.

If you are looking for a table, you may struggle to find a seat on the weekend. Perhaps a weekday may work better for others.

Save this place on Google Maps & come see for yourself why Haraz has become the place to be in Charlotte's coffee scene.

I was super excited to try this place even got confirmation from a friend that LOVED IT (her words). I went today (Saturday) at just after 7am. I greeted everyone (no customers besides me so this was to those working) with a hearty GOOD MORNING! The energy wasn't reciprocated so I considered cultural differences but expected more warmth and welcoming vibes. I received none. I ordered an almond croissant (very tasty but I've had better), the pitch cream cake (it was okay, definitely not compelled to order again), and the Saudi (which I asked about prior  and was dryly responded to)... I wish I hadn't ordered. It's my understanding that they're still fairly new. Regardless for what I expected to be a unique experience...they may consider asking customers "is it your first time?" Making suggestions asking customers what they want...some type of engagement but there was NONE which was disappointing and although they weren't overtly rude they were in no form or fashion nice either. Aesthetically I found it refreshing and modern with hints of traditional elements but nothing made me feel welcome or like I need to go back. Just for the purpose of providing contrast... BACKYARD BREW...walks you through and engages in a way that gives you not only a sense of what you want based on what they offer they give  you an experience that makes you want to return for more. I guess Hazar is about what you want and/or need from your coffee experience. Some may love it but my experience this morning was subpar at best. I plan to return a different time of day to see if me coming so early is why the staff was void of any good vibes. But if they're not ready to GO in every way by 7...they shouldn't open at 7 OR say "we are still prepping this morning but your experience is important to us so don't hesitate...blah blah " customer service though is not even a goal or mission for most places and many consumers just take anything. Not I

This place is amazing ! when you first walk in, it's a very welcoming environment and everyone is super friendly. Although it was busy, I can say that the food and drinks are worth every second of waiting. The Bee Bites are so delicious and the croissants are the best. If you want amazing coffee and great food, I would highly recommend coming here. This is my top new favorite coffee shop in all of charlotte !

I was in Charlotte house hunting and the power went out in my bnb so I decided to try Haraz as it was close and had great reviews. I stood at the counter waiting for someone to notice me but no one ever spoke. One girl in the back locked eyes with me yet didn't bother to say "we'll be right with you" or anything. No one ever said hello or spoke or anything. It was around 6-7 pm on a Thursday and the place was moderately full but not insanely busy for me to go unnoticed. I decided to just sit and read my book but then out of nowhere, they decided to blast the music. Everyone then had to talk louder to hear over the music thus ruining my ability to enjoy my book. I left. Outside of that pastries did look pretty good. Hopefully I'll get to try it if I end up moving to Charlotte.
Didnt try food, the staff are super super nice, the arabic coffe made my night great, music amazing and not loud
Nice place to go
Get the bee bites. Best pastry ever

Great spot with a unique atmosphere! We enjoyed a pistachio latte, red tea, blueberry cheesecake, and Turkish cake. The cheesecake was not my favorite but the Turkish cake was SO good. Definitely recommend to give that a try! The coffee tasted good and the pistachio flavor was well balanced. As a tea lover, I did enjoyed the red tea but I will say it is more suited towards individuals who like spiced teas. It does get quite packed in there and is very busy. We went on a Sunday evening and the line was almost out the door with absolutely no place to sit unless you manage to quickly snag a table. Overall definitely recommend check this place out!

The cafe is very cute and spacious inside.
The staff were super friendly and kindly explained the deserts for us. We will be back to try all the sweets!
They have  wide varieties of Coffees and turkish pastries .Very good ambience and friendly service. With each sip we refreshed a lot. Definitely a must vist.

Found Haraz by accident and it was a wonderful experience! I love the coffee styles they offer and it was the presentation as well that sold me on a new place to gather with friends and colleagues. I prefer bolder coffee and the delicacies that complement the flavors. Give it a try! I am certain others will find it just as enjoyable as I did! Its a fairly new place and definitely a busy atmosphere but the experience is worth it. Thanks for the experience again! See you all again soon! ")
Turkish bakery and coffee, delicious

I saw a reel on Instagram and ended up visiting on their opening day. There was a line out the door -- which meant the community was excited and showing up for Haraz. I saw different coffees and treats come out like the circular croissant, Turkish mosaic cake, and coffee/tea served in gold pots. The interior is beautiful with a warm and cozy glow with additional seating in the back. Staff is super friendly, hard working, and helpful with questions about the menu. I saw the owner working different roles, but providing service with a smile that made it positive and welcoming. Items were selling fast but I got to try the iced Haraz latte, saffron milk cake, and pistachio croissant. The coffee was rich and a smooth flavor which I haven't had before. The saffron cake was not too sweet and delicious with a beautiful presentation. Then the croissant cake was a great treat that would be best served with a hot drink. I really enjoyed my experience and where opening is a dash, the service was still warm and personal while providing great drinks and treats. I can't wait to come back.
Fantastic coffee shop with character and fantastic offerings
I'm absolutely just proud that it's an Arabic coffeehouse

The Tempting selection of coffees and pastries may leave you yearning to try each one simultaneously. I thoroughly enjoyed the Saffron Latte and Biscoff Milk Cake; they were simply divine. Imagining these treats in Charleston, SC, adds a touch of wishful thinking to the experience.
Fantastic chai and dessert! Can't wait to go back

My family and I LOVE coffee and visit  coffee shops in every town and state we visit. Haraz is among our top favorites.  Parking and finding a table to sit at ate sometimes a challenge,  but you just have to have patience.   If the place was empty, wouldn't you question it?? The service is fantastic, everyone is extraordinarily attentive,  helpful and pleasant.  Even the patrons are good natured.  The coffee itself is fantastic! We've tried 5 different coffees on the menu and 3 desserts.  All superb.  And the hours....what a wonderful thing it is to have a local coffee shop that is open late!!  Need I say more.  :)

I ordered a Pistachio Milk Cake, an Almond Croissant, and Haraz coffee. I drove about 40 minutes to come here because I wanted to try food from many different countries. They said the coffee comes from a country called Yemen. The pistachio cake was pretty good. The Haraz coffee tasted a bit like Indian style to me, but  It had a unique aroma and deep flavor. I am going to try a Bee Bite next time.

This place is such a neat coffee shop that isn't immediately in the stress of uptown. The service was fantastic, the coffee delicious, and the vibe was perfect for just hanging out. Not 5 stars because we couldn't find any allergy notices on the pastries, and I ended up having an allergic reaction. I understand we could ask, but there should be some kind of warnings on the pastries. Overall, good experience and I recommend the White Mocha Latte iced.

I kept seeing instagram reels for this place and decided to give it a try!  2/9/2024 I stopped in for coffee and a pastry. I ordered the pistachio latte and an almond croissant.  The pistachio latte was delicious!!  A gentleman working said that the croissants were a little smaller than usual so he gave me two!

The croissant was very tasty and they said nothing was in the middle but I think it had a little bit of almond cream in it.  It wasn't too sweet just right!!
This is an example of a wonderful Middle Eastern coffee place!  The place was packed with people socializing and there's more tables in the back!

I would recommend stopping here for coffee and a pastry!  I look forward to trying more of their items.  I will say due to it being a more specialized coffee place the prices are reflective of that.
My total was $16.64 which included $1.50 tip.
Not an everyday coffee place for me cost wise but was worth the price!

a little overly expensive! ( do not come here on an empty stomach you will go broke fs )
I drank a salted caramel iced latte, so delicious; along with a garlic croissant imo was alright... and a strawberry croissant which was so good!!!! i want to try the chocolate one next time :)  the shop itself was very cozy and warm. the staff there are super sweet and kind!!! loved the vibes of this shop. :)

Absolutely love this spot, the perfect addition to Charlotte and Plaza Midwood! The word is out about their amazing food and Pistachio Latte (my new favorite coffee drink) so make sure you allow plenty of time to get your treats! I love to see this business booming!
Excellent service, Tasted great everything esp Milk cake
Great service, amazing drinks.  We went on a Wednesday afternoon and it wasn't busy.  The Adeni chai and chocolate croissant were both perfect

I just visited Haraz for the first time and loved it! The atmosphere is so vibrant and everyone seems to be enjoying themselves. I even got to talk with one of the owners and he was so kind and passionate about this business. I had the Adeni chai and a raspberry turkish cake, both were delicious! Definitely coming back!

This place is an absolute gem. The atmosphere, hours, welcoming staff, amazing coffee and pastries are phenomenal. I am so glad I found this place. It can be challenging finding middle eastern inspired cuisine in TX but Haraz is my home away from home whenever I'm in Charlotte and a destination I love returning to time and time again.

Very nice place, be careful to watch the prices. Lady rung up my coffee as $30 by mistake.  She corrected it right away. But luckily I saw it on the register.  Coffee good but not many options for dessert.

I didn't even have to taste the coffee in order to enjoy this coffee house. The Establishment - clean, the baristas - so personable, the coffee was just a plus and it was phenomenal. Starbucks couldn't hold a candle up to this place. Best coffee, service, establishment, and small bites in Charlotte. I stand by it
I ordered saffron latte, mosaic raspberry cake and garlic croissant. Worth the try. The ambience is also good but too much crowded and noisy . The service is quick .
I love the focus on yemeni and middle eastern coffee here. So many new and delicious things to try!

Nice location, good atmosphere and friendly staff. Just wish there was proper parking and more information on what the drinks and made with and what they are. Love the music but please no commercials on the speaker.
Unique refreshing coffee and great service...might be my new addiction

Very lively, I enjoy my time there every time I go. Thier coffee/ chai Adani always hits the spot. It's best you go with company because it's very easy to lose track of time and enjoy the conversation while there. I must mention the biscof cheese cake, it is the most delicious thing I have tried there.

I came from LA.... Visited this coffee shop and had a terrible coffee that was recommended by their employees at the register. I didn't care for it and they offered something else and then made me PAY for another drink.

In the meantime attempted to doctor my terrible coffee (what made it terrible was this Cardamom which is a spice I'm not familiar with). Tasted it and didn't like it.

The manager attempted to be helpful but made things worst by trying to explain the "logic" but still didn't any sense or resolved the issue because again I had to pay another 8-9 dollars for drink instead of exchanging it out.

I can't believe how terrible this experience has been and sitting here in this establishment after having  traveled across we the country again from LA to get this treatment.... I don't recommend coming here at all for coffee.

One the plus side the coffee shop is cute but again what's cute with terrible service and experience!!!

Following us leaving: Manager is sitting outside and has the never and audacity to continue this conversation about how my experience was making this worst because he clearly had a miss understanding along with making things worst, dismissed me trying to educate him on how to treat people. His excuses and response was he "wasn't from here" I responded I wasn't either. In all regardless where you are from....RESPECT IS UNIVERSAL!

Again Terrible experience. To top it off. He told me he would refund my moment after attempting to hand me $3 in cash after I'd spend over $25 on the first order and $9 on the second.... $3 dollars. Very insulting! Waited outside for what... to make matters worse!
Everything was pleasant, good atmosphere and nice foods and drink to try.

Worked from this coffee shop for the first time today and loved it! I had the berry milk cake and Haraz latte. Both were delicious. Service is quick and friendly and the atmosphere is upbeat and lively without being overwhelming. Can't wait to come back!!
I came with my husband for a nice yemeni coffee after lunch. We loved it! A new to-go spot for us, this is our second time and we'll keep coming
I'm a caffeine queen. I loved their saffron latte, I almost chugged the whole cup in one gulp. The baristas were great and super welcoming.

The customer service and beverages were outstanding. I ordered an iced pistachio latte and they gave it to me hot ( by accident) but I did not mind. One of the baristas kindly called after me and remade my drink out of courtesy. One of a kind experience, I am so glad Haraz is in the neighborhood.
Charlotte needs more Middle Eastern/Arab/Turkish cafe food spots, so I am extremely satisfied about Haraz Coffee.

If I could give a zero star I would, my brother went to Haraz Coffee this evening and was ignored for over 15 minutes while the workers were standing around talking to each other and then proceed to joke around when his wife come in angry for them to finally take their order? I think there's a time and place to talk to your co-workers; one of those times are not when there's a customer waiting for over 15 minutes to get their order taken. To anyone who does go there, hopefully you don't experience the same thing they did.

Have never felt so angered in my life. Worst experience of any coffee shop ever. I came in the front and went to the front counter to order but end up standing there for at least 15 minutes. Ignored and all the workers were just talking among their self. Did not pay any attention to me. I wore a navy hoodie and some grey sweats with black crocs. Asian male. Was it my clothes the reason they ignored me? Hope not. You should treat your customers equally but anyway. My wife got mad and told me to come back inside with her and they finally took my order. I can tell they already felt the fumes coming from her so they were trying to make jokes. I do not recommend promoting this business and wish no one have the same experience. I will not come back to this establishment ever again.
If i can give a 0 i definitely will...they busy talkin to each others than takin order...my husband stand there for almost 15min and be completely ignored...he walk out but I can't get over that...
Good place but tooooo crowded
Great tasting tea and coffee! Amazing pastries. Nice, clean place to eat and talk. One of my favorite spots already.

Delicious coffee shop with amazing drinks and pastries. The service is top notch, bringing your food out and drink out on a tray to your table. Clean environment and love the music. Would be a great place for a meeting or getting work done.

Well, Haraz coffee house was opened recently on Dec 28, 2023, and it's one of the best cafes in charlotte, which I have visited so far. They have unique menu and variety. I mostly liked the bee bites which I found nowhere else. Every item is both good in taste and fresh. It's definitely a try out place with friends.
This place was amazing! So many spicy coffees and delicious sweets.
Great place! Always busy but 100% worth the wait! Love coming here and getting their chai. The lattes are great too. Very unique taste but delicious! A must try when in Charlotte!
It's super crowded and the parking is little, but I loved the coffee and milk cake and butter crossiant.

The atmosphere is perfection to the greatest, the people are polite and so nice, the coffee is amazing and just upon entry it feels like you just have to smile. I can't quite explain it but the air just has a feeling to it that is like none other.

Nice atmosphere , delicious coffee but service can be better. I ordered three items and they delivered to my table  separately one by one. I know they are new and need more time , but definitely I will  Back

My friend and I visited Haraz Coffee for a nice late night coffee spot to hang. Parking was a bit difficult since it's shared with ShareTea.

We ordered the Raspberry Mosiac Cake, Pistachio Milk Cake, Hot Regular Latte, Dragonfruit Refresher, and Garlic Croissant.

The Raspberry Mosiac Cake was rich, Pistachio Milk Cake was moist and delicious, we both enjoyed our drink choices. I really wanted to try to Bee Bites, but they sold out. Which is fine because I plan to visit again!

I also like that there's a good amount of seating inside and the interior is so sleek.
Cute space with a good selection of authentic middle eastern coffee and desserts. Highly recommend!

Cute coffee shop. Drink and food selection was great. You could see they brew the tea with pots then pour over to the cup. Staff there were nice and helpful. Seats were pretty comfortable, and there is also a back space which was quieter.
Four star because the speed of coffee making seems not very efficient. Tea was served pretty fast, but the two barista who were making coffee seemed a bit slow. Also, we had two pistachio latte and one was sweeter than the other.
Perhaps not for people who want to grab a quick drink and run, but worth make a stop and enjoy something from the menu.
Lovely coffee
LOVE this coffee shop! Great coffee, great desserts, beautiful lighting and art.
